description: When a documentary crew arrives at Mifflin, manager Michael Scott attempts to paint a rosy picture but fails after learning the company will be downsizing.
title: Pilot

description: Michael tells everyone it was his idea to hire a special consultant to teach racial tolerance and diversity, when in fact it was his behavior that necessitated the training.
title: Diversity Day

description: When Dwight gets the authority to choose a health plan for everyone, the power quickly goes to his head, infuriating his co-workers.
title: Health Care

description: Michael tries to raise employee morale with a birthday party amid rumors of downsizing.
title: The Alliance

description: Michael is overly confident about his team's chances in a basketball game between the office staff and the warehouse workers.
title: Basketball

description: An attractive woman's arrival has the male staff members vying for her attention.
title: Hot Girl

description: The Dunder Mifflin employees suffer through the annual office awards ceremony, "The Dundies."
title: The Dundies

description: When Michael's best friend, sales representative Todd Packer (David Koechner), pays him a visit, Michael starts behaving even more inappropriately.
title: Sexual Harassment

description: Michael has a panic attack while trying to close the deal on his condo; with Michael and Dwight out of the office, Jim and Pam organize an employee competition.
title: Office Olympics

description: A fire in the kitchen causes the employees to evacuate to the parking lot where they learn more about one another than they wanted.
title: The Fire

description: Michael must fire someone, which puts a damper on the Halloween festivities.
title: Halloween

description: After Dwight karate-punches Michael, Jim organizes a lunchtime rematch at Dwight's dojo.
title: The Fight

description: Michael surprises his boss when he and Jan try to attract a new client (Tim Meadows).
title: The Client

description: Everyone is on edge during performance review, including Michael, who steals the employee suggestion box to get ideas he can present to his boss.
title: Performance Review

description: When Michael begins monitoring their e-mails, he manages to upset all of the employees.
title: Email Surveillance

description: After Michael suggests a game of "Yankee Swap" with the Secret Santa gifts, everyone fights over Michael's gift to Ryan, bringing morale to an all-time low.
title: Christmas Party

description: When Michael takes the Mifflin crew on a motivational harbor cruise, things get out of hand and Michael ends up in the brig.
title: Booze Cruise

description: After he has an accident while using a grill, injured Michael demands attention from the entire Dunder Mifflin office.
title: The Injury

description: Because Jim fears Michael will tell the others he likes Pam, he pretends to be Michael's best friend.
title: The Secret

description: When someone stains the carpet in Michael's office, he begins to question his popularity among his staff.
title: The Carpet

description: When Jan (Melora Hardin) conducts a seminar for the female employees, Michael takes the guys to the warehouse for some male bonding.
title: Boys and Girls

description: Michael visits corporate headquarters in New York on Valentine's Day.
title: Valentine's Day

description: When Dwight, who has a fear of public speaking, is asked to give a speech at a sales convention, he turns to Michael for help.
title: Dwight's Speech

description: Michael strikes up a friendship with the 5-year-old daughter of his enemy when children visit the office.
title: Take Your Daughter To Work Day

description: Michael takes the Dunder Mifflin employees ice-skating to celebrate his birthday.
title: Michael's Birthday

description: Dwight finds half a joint in the parking lot and launches a full investigation; Michael asks an unusual favor.
title: Drug Testing

description: Chaos ensues when Michael takes responsibility for conflict resolution from the Human Relations department.
title: Conflict Resolution

description: Employees take some big gambles when they host a charity casino-night in their warehouse.
title: Casino Night

description: Michael unintentionally outs a gay employee; the situation with Jim and Pam.
title: Gay Witch Hunt

description: Michael organizes a party in his hotel room when he, Dwight and Jan attend a convention in Philadelphia.
title: The Convention

description: After Jan busts Michael for having a "movie Monday," Angela pushes Dwight to make a play for Michael's job.
title: The Coop

description: Michael tries to help the staff grieve after learning that the former regional manager has died.
title: Grief Counseling

description: Dwight takes Ryan on his first sales call, subjecting him to an outrageous series of tests along the way.
title: Initiation

description: Michael urges the staff to support Kelly and attend a local celebration of the Hindu Festival of Lights.
title: Diwali

description: Michael strives to keep the staff's spirit up after learning of the Scranton branch shutting down; people envision how their lives will change.
title: Branch Closing

description: Jim and Pam reunite when the Scranton and Stamford branches of the company merge.
title: The Merger

description: Michael tries to be supportive after learning that a new employee is an ex-convict, then the staff compares the office to a prison.
title: The Convict

description: Strife on the party-planning committee results in two competing Christmas parties; Michael gets dumped for the holidays.
title: A Benihana Christmas Part 1 & 2

description: Michael returns from his Jamaican vacation; an e-mail of a racy vacation photo makes the rounds of the office.
title: Back from Vacation

description: Andy suggests that Michael team up the staff for sales calls; Dwight tries to cover for Angela when she misses a deadline.
title: Traveling Salesmen

description: Oscar returns from his long vacation; Andy takes advantage of events to get closer to Michael; Jim gets Karen and Pam to help stage a prank on a new target.
title: The Return

description: Michael brings two adult performers into the office in honor of Phyllis' wedding shower; Karen confronts Pam about her past with Jim.
title: Ben Franklin

description: Michael brings two adult performers into the office in honor of Phyllis' wedding shower; Karen confronts Pam about her past with Jim.
title: Phyllis' Wedding

description: Ryan invites Michael to be a guest speaker at his business school; Dwight battles a bat that is loose in the office; Pam invites co-workers to her first art show.
title: Business School

description: Michael and Jan make their relationship public during a party; Jim meets Karen's ex; the staff goes to happy hour for drinks.
title: Cocktails

description: Darryl meets with Michael to negotiate a pay increase; Jim deals with the consequences of Pam's confession to Roy.
title: The Negotiation

description: Andy returns from anger-management classes, planning to make a fresh start with his co-workers; Michael and Dwight try to illustrate the dangers of the workplace.
title: Safety Training

description: The staff goes into crisis mode after a shipment of paper goes out with an obscene watermark; Michael holds an impromptu press conference; Jim and Andy handle harried clients who used the paper.
title: Product Recall

description: Outrage breaks out in the office when Phyllis gets an eyeful from a flasher; Dwight and Andy work on catching the perpetrator.
title: Woman's Appreciation

description: Michael must recommend his own replacement when the company considers him for a corporate position; Pam must watch Jim and Karen have fun together at a company outing.
title: Beach Games

description: Michael, Jim and Karen go to New York to interview for a job opening; in Scranton, the new regime institutes sweeping reforms; Jan brings exciting news.
title: The Job

description: A freak accident causes Michael to think the office is cursed; Michael decides to hold a charity 5K fun run; further developments in co-workers' romances.
title: Fun Run Part 1 & 2

description: Ryan returns to Dunder-Mifflin's Scranton branch to bring the company into the digital age; Angela remains unhappy about her cat.
title: Dunder-Mifflin Infinity Part 1 & 2

description: Michael anticipates going to New York for the company's Web site launch party; Dwight tries to sell more paper in one day than the Web site does.
title: Launch Party Part 1 & 2

description: Michael tries to combat his growing debt by asking employees for loans; Jim and Pam spend a night at Dwight's family farm.
title: Money Part 1 & 2

description: Michael seizes the opportunity to exhibit his creativity when the Scranton branch must participate in a company ad; Dwight explores an online world.
title: Local Ad

description: Michael fights back when Karen tries to woo Stanley away from Scranton; a Finer Things Club further disturbs Dunder Mifflin's calm.
title: Branch Wars

description: When Ryan excludes him from a wilderness retreat, Michael goes into the woods for his own survival adventure; Jim tries to revolutionize the office birthday party.
title: Survior Man

description: Jan sues Dunder Mifflin, and Michael is deposed as a witness; Kelly trash-talks Pam after Darryl beats Jim at pingpong.
title: The Deposition

description: Pam and Jim run out of excuses and must go to Jan and Michael's house for dinner; when Dwight learns that Angela and Andy are also invited, jealousy gets the best of him.
title: Dinner Party

description: A model in an office-supply catalog makes Michael feel things; to win back Dunder-Mifflin's parking spaces, Kevin and Andy oppose bosses of five businesses.
title: Chair Model

description: Michael and Dwight decide to surprise Ryan in New York; Scranton staffers must work on a Saturday for Ryan's Web site project.
title: Night Out

description: Michael tries to give Stanley an attitude adjustment after Stanley snaps at him; Dwight decides to buy Andy's car; after spending the night at Jim's, Pam deals with an unexpected inconvenience.
title: Did I Stutter?

description: Jim hits the golf course with Andy and Kevin in hope of landing a huge client; Michael sets up a booth at a job fair at Pam's alma mater to hire a summer intern.
title: Job Fair

description: Michael demands Toby's goodbye party at Dunder Mifflin be a huge celebration; Dwight and Meredith haze Holly (Amy Ryan), the new human resources person.
title: Goodbye, Toby Part 1 & 2

description: Staffers in the Scranton branch of Dunder Mifflin become obsessed with their weight in the wake of corporate weight-loss initiatives; Michael pursues a friendship with Holly (Amy Ryan); Jim misses Pam, who is away at art school.
title: Weight Loss Part 1 & 2

description: A business ethics seminar gets out of control when Michael lets everyone talk about their unethical behavior at work; Jim makes Dwight observe the company's "time theft" policy.
title: Business Ethics

description: Michael has Dwight go over possible birthing scenarios to prepare for the birth of Jan's baby; Michael tells Holly he will pretend not to like her for Jan's benefit.
title: Baby Shower

description: Michael helps Pam get a part-time job so she can afford art school; Michael and Holly get an early start on their date night; after the office is robbed, Michael decides to raise money for all of the lost items.
title: Crime Aid

description: Pam is embarrassed when no one else at corporate wears a costume on Halloween; Holly and Michael get shocking news from corporate; Dwight tries to get under Andy's skin.
title: Employee Transfer

description: Jim and Dwight are stunned when they get the results of the annual customer survey report; Jim and Pam decide to spend every minute together; Andy and Angela choose an unusual location for their wedding.
title: Customer Survey

description: Michael is thrilled when David Wallace sends him on a business trip to Canada; Oscar and Andy become friends when Michael decides to bring them on the trip; Jim counts the days until Pam returns from art school.
title: Business Trip

description: Someone made a huge mess in the microwave and refuses to clean it up; Michael must come to terms with the personnel changes in his staff.
title: Frame Toby

description: Oscar informs Michael that the office must spend a cash surplus or lose it in the next year's budget; Dwight takes Angela and Andy to Schrute Farms to work on their wedding plans.
title: The Surplus

description: Meredith's hair catches fire at Phyllis' Moroccan-themed Christmas party; Dwight corners the market on the hottest toy of the holiday season.
title: Moroccan Christmas

description: Andy remains unaware of Angela's affair with Dwight; Michael is nervous about a corporate meeting with Wallace (Andy Buckley).
title: The Duel

description: Andy remains unaware of Angela's affair with Dwight; Michael is nervous about a corporate meeting with Wallace (Andy Buckley).
title: Prince Family Paper

description: Dwight must make amends with the office after his fire-safety seminar goes awry; Michael tries to get his employees to relax; Andy becomes convinced that Pam and Jim are film gurus.
title: Stress Relief Part 1 & 2

description: Michael takes Pam with him on a tour of the other branches to explain Scranton's relative success; Dwight and Jim, the new heads of the party planning committee, forget a birthday.
title: Lecture Circuit Part 1

description: Michael and Pam continue their branch tour; Jim and Dwight try to fulfill their party planning duties; Angela's new cat causes a commotion.
title: Lecture Circuit Part 2

description: Michael meets a mysterious woman at a blood drive; Dwight and Kevin attend a "Lonely Hearts Party"; Jim and Pam have an awkward lunch with Bob and Phyllis.
title: Blood Drive

description: Michael comes up with an idea that causes a huge problem in the office; Pam, Jim and Andy each give Kevin different advice on wooing a woman.
title: Golden Ticket

description: Michael makes big plans for his 15th anniversary party at Dunder Mifflin; Jim plays a prank on Dwight that has unexpected results.
title: New Boss

description: Michael's relationship with the new vice president gets increasingly tense; Pam finds the new copier a challenge.
title: Two Weeks

description: Jim faces Charles during a soccer game in the Dunder Mifflin parking lot; Michael finds himself afraid to face the workday.
title: Dream Team

description: Dwight and Andy plan a hunting trip; Charles (Idris Elba) asks Jim for a "rundown", and Jim tries to figure out what that is; Michael hosts a Paper & Pancakes luncheon.
title: Michael Scott Paper Company

description: Dwight's devotion to Michael is tested; Andy tries to fulfill Jim's emotional needs.
title: Heavy Competition

description: Michael's new company has a hard time making early-morning deliveries; the office struggles to get expense reports in on time when Angela enforces the company policy.
title: Broke

description: Michael must settle a dispute within the sales team; employees cause trouble when they take the term "casual" Friday too loosely.
title: Casual Friday

description: Michael brings dancing and coffee to the office; Jim and Pam plan a secret trip.
title: Cafe Disco

description: Michael reunites with Holly (Amy Ryan) at Dunder Mifflin's annual company picnic while the rest of the staff competes in a volleyball tournament.
title: Company Picnic

description: Michael feels left out when the rest of the staff gossips about the summer interns, so he hunts for a juicy secret to share.
title: Gossip

description: Jim makes a request that leaves Michael feeling defensive and insecure; Pam works on the guest list for the wedding; Toby and Dwight go under cover to investigate a workers' comp claim.
title: The Meeting

description: The news breaks that not everyone will be getting a raise; Dwight reaches his breaking point with Jim; Pam wants cash instead of wedding gifts.
title: The Promotion

description: The office mates travel to Niagara Falls to celebrate Jim and Pam's wedding; Michael, Dwight and Andy want to hook up with wedding guests; Jim lets a secret slip at the rehearsal dinner.
title: Niagara Part 1 & 2

description: Dwight and Andy convince Michael that an insurance salesman who visits the office is part of the Mafia.
title: Mafia

description: Michael shocks Pam and Jim when he reveals the identity of his new girlfriend; Dwight offers Jim a strange peace offering.
title: The Lover

description: The office plans a haunted house for children in the community; Michael falls into a koi pond at an important business meeting.
title: Koi Pond

description: Having run out of excuses, Jim and Pam are forced to go on an uncomfortable double date with Michael and Helena (Linda Purl); Dwight is doing nice things for everyone in the office.
title: Double Date

description: Troubling rumors about Dunder Mifflin rock Michael's world; strange diversions upset Jim; Andy finds that his awkwardness is his biggest hurdle in courting Erin.
title: Murder

description: When David Wallace invites Michael to the Dunder Mifflin shareholder meeting in New York, Michael brings Oscar, Dwight and Andy along; Jim tries to get Ryan to do work.
title: Shareholder Meeting

description: Michael must tell the truth when he realizes he cannot keep a promise he made to a group of kids 10 years ago; Jim starts an employee-of-the-month program to boost employee morale.
title: Scott's Tots

description: Michael is outraged when Jim lets Phyllis be Santa at the office Christmas party; Jim and Dwight try to get everyone in the holiday spirit; Oscar has a secret crush.
title: Secret Santa

description: Michael, Dwight, Pam and Andy try to impress a potential buyer who comes to Dunder Mifflin; Michael remembers good times they have had in the office.
title: The Banker

description: Michael has a difficult time accepting Sabre's new policies; Erin waits for Andy to ask her on a date.
title: Sabre

description: The Sabre CEO (Kathy Bates) visits the Scranton office and says either Michael or Jim must go back to being a salesman; Andy's Valentine's Day plan backfires.
title: The Manager and the Salesman

description: When Pam's contractions begin, she and Jim try to wait things out as long as possible so they can have more time at the hospital; Michael anxiously awaits the baby's arrival; Erin makes Andy jealous when she has lunch with Kevin.
title: The Delivery Part 1 & 2

description: Michael tries to impress Jo; Dwight causes trouble on Jim's first day back from paternity leave; Erin and Andy go on their first date.
title: St. Patrick's Day

description: Members of the sales staff let Sabre's new Sales Is King policy go to their heads.
title: New Leads

description: Michael tries to impress one of Pam and Jim's friends; Erin and Andy try to keep their relationship a secret; Dwight reconsiders his contract with Angela.
title: Happy Hour

description: Andy tries to make Secretary's Day memorable for Erin; Oscar circulates a viral video comparing Kevin's voice to Cookie Monster's.
title: Secretary's Day

description: Pam and Jim work on their first joint sales pitch; Michael misreads body language; Dwight encourages Kelly to try out for the minority training program.
title: Body Language

description: Michael thinks his girlfriend is cheating on him and asks Dwight to investigate; Andy becomes frustrated when no one takes his customer's complaint seriously.
title: The Cover-Up

description: Michael is surprisingly cheerful after learning bad news about Donna; new parents Pam and Jim have a hard time staying awake at the office; Dwight refuses to honor a contract.
title: The Chump

description: When the press learns that Sabre's printers catch on fire, Jo (Kathy Bates) tries to find out who the whistle-blower is.
title: Whistlelower

description: Michael refuses to fire the new office assistant when people complain about his bad attitude; Pam tries to impress Jim by pulling an office prank.
title: Nepotism

description: Corporate forces Michael into counseling with Toby; Dwight seeks revenge after a shop owner snubs him; Pam tries to change her job title.
title: Counseling

description: Andy invites the office to a play he is in, hoping that Erin will attend; Jim and Pam struggle with their incompetent baby sitter.
title: Andy's Play

description: Thinking he has herpes, Michael contacts all his ex-girlfriends; Andy holds a sex education meeting for the office.
title: Sex Ed

description: Michael, Dwight and Jim set up a sting after a competing sales associate steals a client; Andy starts a band.
title: The Sting

description: Michael freaks out when Darryl goes over his head and takes an idea to corporate; a Halloween costume contest puts the office in a competitive mood.
title: Costume Contest

description: Michael invites the entire office to celebrate the christening of Pam and Jim's baby.
title: Christening

description: Erin and Gabe host a "Glee" viewing party; Michael is upset when people refer to Gabe as his boss; Andy becomes increasingly jealous.
title: Viewing Party

description: Michael helps convince people to invest in Ryan's Internet company; trying to capitalize on Thanksgiving, Dwight creates a hay festival in the parking lot; a new policy prevents Jim from earning commission.
title: WUPHF.com

description: Michael decides he must stop China before it takes over the United States; Pam threatens to move the company to a new building.
title: China

description: Michael is happy when Toby takes a leave of absence and corporate sends Holly Flax to fill in; Pam must plan a second Christmas party when Michael wants the party to be on the day of Holly's return to Scranton.
title: Classy Christmas Part 1 & 2

description: Michael readies himself for the news about Holly's relationship; Pam puts up a board for everyone to post their New Year's resolutions.
title: Ultimatum

description: Holly and Michael turn Andy's business seminar into an improv challenge; Erin and Gabe compete in a board game battle.
title: The Seminar

description: Jim is forced to abandon Michael at a gas station after receiving an emergency phone call; Erin, Dwight and Holly (Amy Ryan) search for Michael; Pam's art inspires a captioning contest that appears to offend Gabe.
title: The Search

description: Public displays of affection between Holly and Michael make everyone uncomfortable; Jim and Pam experience the aftermath of a bottomless champagne lunch; Andy tags along on Erin's romantic treasure hunt.
title: PDA

description: After 11 years of preparation, Michael is ready to debut his action movie.
title: Threat Level Midnight

description: Dunder Mifflin traveling salesman Todd Packer comes to the office looking for a desk job; Andy fights Pam for a new computer.
title: Todd Packer

description: Michael decides to ask Holly to marry him; the office has a garage sale.
title: Garage Sale

description: Everyone hopes to make good first impressions with the new manager, Deangelo Vickers (Will Ferrell).
title: Training Day

description: Michael teaches Deangelo how to host the Dundie Awards; Erin struggles with her feelings for Gabe.
title: Michael's Last Dundies

description: Michael wants a drama-free day to say goodbye to his friends; Deangelo and Andy work to keep Michael's most-important clients.
title: Goodbye, Michael

description: When Deangelo plays favorites, his management style is exposed.
title: The Inner Circle

description: Dwight uses his position as acting manager to employ harsh policies in the office; Gabe tries to get Erin back.
title: Dwight K. Schrute, (Acting) Manager

description: Jim heads a team that interviews applicants, including several co-workers; Dwight tries to reassert himself as a contender.
title: Search Committee Part 1 & 2

description: The staff go into frantic speculation after accidentally discovering a list of their names in a notebook belonging to the mysterious new CEO.
title: The List

description: Robert challenges the office to double their sales; Pam finds an unlikely pregnancy friend.
title: The Incentive

description: After the warehouse employees win the lottery and quit their jobs, everyone in the office fantasizes about winning big; Darryl and Andy look for new warehouse workers.
title: Lotto

description: When Andy decides to throw a garden party at Schrute Farms to impress Robert, Dwight researches how to be a good host; Andy's family makes him feel self conscious.
title: Garden Party

description: Erin tries to put on a Halloween party that will please both Andy and Robert California; Jim and Pam fight about the existence of ghosts; Dwight bonds with Robert California's son.
title: Spooked

description: Dwight installs a device in the office that will get everyone fired if they make too many errors.
title: Doomsday

description: Pam teams up with Dwight to prove that Jim thinks her temporary replacement is pretty; Robert California asks to join Andy, Darryl and Kevin's band.
title: Pam's Replacement

description: Andy tries to motivate the staff by taking them on a field trip to Gettysburg; Robert asks those who stay behind to come up with the company's next big idea.
title: Gettysburg

description: Robert California brings his wife (Maura Tierney) into the office to find her a job; Dwight opens a gym in the building.
title: Mrs.California

description: Andy tries to make holiday wishes come true; Robert decides to drown his sorrows at the office party.
title: Christmas Wishes

description: Andy gets the office involved in a trivia contest; Dwight explores job opportunities at Sabre headquarters.
title: Trivia

description: When Robert decides to sell his mansion, Kevin suggests he throw a pool party for the office; Erin flirts with Dwight to get Andy's attention; Robert gives a tour of his home.
title: Pool Party

description: When Jim returns from jury duty Dwight questions him about the case; Angela and the senator welcome their new baby.
title: Jury Duty

description: When Dwight receives a special assignment in Tallahassee, he and Andy must decide which Scranton employees will go with him; Pam returns from maternity leave.
title: Special Project

description: In Tallahassee, Fla., Dwight tries to impress Sabre's special projects president; Andy tries to avoid requests for raises.
title: Tallahassee

description: Dwight and Packer compete for a job; Jim receives an unwelcome visitor; Andy has everyone stay late to cover for their co-workers in Florida.
title: After Hours

description: Dwight tries to impress Nellie with a theatrical presentation at the Sabre store opening; Andy suffers from an embarrassing injury.
title: Test the Store

description: After Robert reveals his contempt for Nellie's (Catherine Tate) business plan, Jim tries to save Dwight's job; Andy discovers that Erin isn't returning to Scranton.
title: Lasy Day in Florida

description: Andy drives across the country to get Erin; Nellie shows up and tries to claim the manager position.
title: Get the Girl

description: Robert forces the office to throw a welcome party for Nellie; Erin helps Andy practice how he will break up with Jessica.
title: Welcome Party

description: After returning from his romantic quest, Andy battles with Nellie for the manager's chair; Kelly has a difficult time choosing between Ryan and a perfect man (Sendhil Ramamurthy).
title: Angry Andy

description: Andy crashes a fundraiser and ends up adopting 12 dogs; Dwight learns that an auction winner loses money; Nellie learns how to eat a taco.
title: Fundraiser

description: Andy tries to jumpstart his comeback; after Robert drunkenly shuts down a local branch, Jim and Dwight join forces in hope of outsmarting a salesman.
title: Turf War

description: A former boss helps Andy go under cover and stage a coup; a new opportunity arises for Robert.
title: Free Family Portrait Studio

description: Jim and Dwight are thrown off by the arrival of two young employees that the other dub "the new Jim" and "Dwight Jr." Andy returns from training.
title: New Guys

description: Pam and Jim go to Roy's wedding, where his toast takes everyone by surprise -- causing Pam and Jim to examine their own relationship.
title: Roy's Wedding

description: Andy learns he is related to Michelle Obama, causing a stir around the office. Jim's elaborate trick has Dwight thinking Jim is an Asian man.
title: Andy's Ancestry

description: After Jim convinces Dwight that the building is unsafe, Dwight rents a bus and sets up the office inside -- and eventually they hit the road.
title: Work Bus

description: It's Halloween in the office, and Andy invites his college a cappella group to perform, which leads to a comfrontation with his frenemy Broccoli Rob.
title: Here Comes Treble

description: Andy must man up when his dad blows all of the family's money. When Dwight is interviewed on local radio, Jim tortures him with bizarre call-ins.
title: The Boat

description: To help Dwight overcome his greatest professional handicap -- selling to woman -- Pam and the ladies teach him how to interact with female clients.
title: The Whale

description: Angela discovers her husband's affair and goes to Dwight for help. Jim needs a favor from Stanley and Phyllis, who milk it for all it's worth.
title: The Target

description: When the party planning committee drops the ball on the Christmas party, Dwight gets everyone to celebrate a traditional Scrute German Christmas.
title: Dwight Christmas

description: Pam accidentally brings lice into the office and lets Meredith take the fall. Meanwhile, Jim woos a potential business associate in Philadelphia.
title: Lice

description: Dwight and Clark pose as father and son to make a sale. Meanwhile, Darrly interviews at Jim's company and Pam comes for a surprise visit.
title: Suit Warehouse

description: Dwight tries to prevent Darrl's move to Athlead. Jim is forced to miss Cece's first recital when a big investor exits his new company.
title: Customer Loyalty

description: David Wallace tasks Dwight with finding a new part-time salesman to fill in for Jim. Dwight assembles a super-team of his cronies, starting with Mose.
title: Junior Salesman

description: When Pam's warehouse mural is defaced, Dwight and Mellie spring to action. Darryl has difficulty dealing with Jim's habits in their shared apartment.
title: Vandalism

description: The office pairs off into pretend couples to take advantage of a Valentine's Day discount at the mall. Erin assures Pete she will break up with Andy.
title: Couple's Discount

description: Pam interviews for a job in Philadelphia with a manager who gives her deja-vu. Dwight brings Angela on a mission to clean his elderly Aunt Shirley.
title: Moving On

description: Dwight travels home for a customary Schrute funeral. He and his siblings recieve a surpise inheritance that's not entirely welcome.
title: The Farm

description: Everyone is excited when promos start running on TV for the documentary. Dwight makes Angela jealous when he starts dating a Brussels sprout farmer.
title: Promos

description: "Stairmageddon" strikes when the elevator goes out and everyone is forced to take the stairs. Dwight forces Stanely to do an important sales call.
title: Stairmageddon

description: Dwight and Angela compete in an office-wide paper airplane contest. A local talent agent helps Andy and his first acting role in an industrial film.
title: Paper Airplane

description: Andy tries to work up the nerve to quit his job and pursue his dreams of stardom. Dwight finally recieves his karate black belt from his new sensei.
title: Livin' the Dream

description: While the office readies for the documentary premiere. Jim holds tryouts to hire an assistant to the assistant to the regional manager.
title: A.A.R.M

description: In the series finale, months after the airing of the documentary the workers of Dunder Mifflin, past and present, gather for a wedding.
title: Finale
